reviews.text:
This railway station sits on the line that heads towards Huddersfield in one direction and towards Sheffield in the other direction.

There is a nearby car park that can accommodate about 8 or 9 cars. 

Yes there is one space for a disabled driver.

And yes there is a drop-off area as well.

This railway station has only one platform, and it also only has one railway line passing through it.

There are a number of areas where people can sit down and wait for the train. Some of these seating areas are covered as well.

There are no on-site staff here and consequently there is a automatic ticketing machine on the platform.

This railway station also has a bicycle rack and can accommodate about 2 or 3 bicycles at best.

There are visible signs of security at this platform by way of closed-circuit television cameras.

I only decided to give this railway station three stars out of five because the station signage from my perspective wasn't great. In fact when I went into to the entrance (that I thought was the entrance), it confused me because I ended up going up some old dirt track which lead to nowhere.
Great thing I love it I got a dinosaur for free !!!!
Great Station! Been going for years. It was my local, but isn't any more. There needs to be more there that's all.
